result.execSummary:
The defendant Nakia C Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Release privileges for Day Reporting Program only.

miscConds.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.

timeConds.notes: 10 hours of community service on each charge for a total of 20 hours.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count one.  Release privilegs for Day Reporting Center only.  Credit for two days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nakia C Lewis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nakia C Lewis in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program only and 2 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction - concurrent with Count 1 - with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program only and 2 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years - concurrent.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) AODA, treatment or program; 5) perform 10 hours of community service on each charge for a total of 20 hours. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Nakia C Lewis in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 8/5/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  All parties are informed that as of August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Konkol,  Branch 44, Room 316 of the Safety Building. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed due to missed office contact.  aw

Defendant Nakia C Lewis in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 5/27/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Nakia C Lewis in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless. Ron Dague for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed. Justice Point Pretiral Report dated 3/5/15.
HMP

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no drug paraphernalia.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nakia C Lewis in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Nakia C Lewis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
